Key Match Events: Paolo Banchero returned to the court after missing 34 games due to a torn right oblique and scored 34 points.
Orlando Magic narrowly lost to the Milwaukee Bucks with a score of 109-106.
Banchero shot 11-for-21 from the field, including 5-for-8 from beyond the arc, and converted 7-of-10 free throws in 27 minutes.
Banchero also contributed seven rebounds, three assists, two steals, and a block.
Post-Match Reflections: Paolo Banchero reflected on the challenges of regaining his rhythm and conditioning after his injury.
Banchero expressed satisfaction with his overall performance despite feeling a little sore and weak initially.
Head coach Jamahl Mosley praised Banchero’s performance, emphasizing his poise and determination.
Banchero admitted he didn’t expect such a strong performance and remained focused on improving as he regains full strength.
Others: The Magic, now 22-18, have dropped to fifth in the Eastern Conference following two consecutive losses.
Banchero’s return provides a significant boost as Orlando looks to bounce back in their next matchup against the Philadelphia 76ers.
